artist: Attributed to William Pentecost; Crocker-Wheeler Electric Manufacturing Company
description: narrow toaster with openings on both ends; bakelite base; attached cord
text: The "Toast-O-Lator" was a new, innovative solution to toasting both sides of the bread simultaneously, the only home toaster that moves bread slices while being toasted by means of a built-in, conveyer-belt assembly line. Completely automatic, a slice is inserted at one end and continues past the "Wind-O-Spy" porthole permitting one to monitor the toast's progress end to end. The left base is purposely rounded so the toast will drop down and out on a plate.
title: "Toast-O-Lator" toaster, model GE4473
